main event: Witnesses observed a circular, yellowish-orange object at Glasgow AFB for three consecutive nights.
interesting points: The object appeared to twinkle for about 2 minutes before becoming more stationary., It was determined to be probably a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object., The object was visible at a 10-degree elevation and 45-degree azimuth., The observation involved 9 witnesses at the control tower., The object was thought to be a star called Arcturus.
witness description: military personnel including M/2C Charlie M. Coddington, M/2C Ray A. Bernhard, and M/3C Hilario H. Fernandez
